de.renew.dbnets.datalogic

Class ActionCall

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.renew.dbnets.datalogic.ActionCall
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    de.renew.net.TransitionInscription, java.io.Serializable

    public class ActionCall
extends java.lang.Object
implements de.renew.net.TransitionInscription
    The action call - the db-net's data logic layer's action's usage in the concrete db-net's transition.
    Author:
    Anton Rigin, National Research University - Higher School of Economics, Faculty of Computer Science, Master Degree Program "System and Software Engineering", the 1st year student. Term Project (Coursework) on the Topic "Reference and Data Semantic-Based Simulator of Petri Nets Extension with the Use of Renew Tool". HSE University, Moscow, Russia, 2019 - 2020.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Specified by:
        makeOccurrences in interface de.renew.net.TransitionInscription
        Parameters:

        searcher - The searcher instance.
        Returns:
        The empty list of the action call's occurrences.

        connection - The database connection instance.

      • mapAddedFactToPreparedStatement

        private java.util.Optional<ActionCall.PreparedStatementWithParams> mapAddedFactToPreparedStatement(EditedFact addedFact,
                                                                                                   java.sql.Connection connection)
        Converts the added fact into the prepared statement (with params) based on the insert SQL/DML query.
        Parameters:
        addedFact - The added fact - the row of the table being added to the database during the action performing.
        connection - The database connection instance.
        Returns:
        The optional instance of the prepared statement (with params) for the added fact.

      • mapEditActionSqlToPreparedStatement

        private java.util.Optional<ActionCall.PreparedStatementWithParams> mapEditActionSqlToPreparedStatement(java.lang.String sql,
                                                                                                       java.util.List<java.lang.Object> params,
                                                                                                       java.sql.Connection connection)
        Returns the prepared statement (with params) based on the SQL/DML query for the edited (added/deleted) fact or the empty optional instance if it is impossible to form the prepared statement.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL/DML query for the edited (added/deleted) fact.
        params - The params for the fact editing (adding/deleting).
        connection - The database connection instance.
        Returns:
        The prepared statement (with params) based on the SQL/DML query for the edited (added/deleted) fact or the empty optional instance if it is impossible to form the prepared statement.

      • executePreparedStatement

        private void executePreparedStatement(ActionCall.PreparedStatementWithParams preparedStatement,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> paramsValuesMap,
                                      de.renew.expression.VariableMapper variableMapper)
                               throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                      de.renew.unify.Impossible
        Executes the edited (added/deleted) fact's prepared statement.
        Parameters:
        preparedStatement - The edited (added/deleted) fact's prepared statement.
        paramsValuesMap - The map of the values for the edited (added/deleted) facts' params.
        variableMapper - The transition instance's variable mapper. Maps the net's variables' names into their values.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the database error occurred during the prepared statement execution.
        de.renew.unify.Impossible - If the param(-s) has(have) invalid type or null.

        Parameters:
        preparedStatement - The prepared statement.
        columnValue - The value for setting.
        i - The column's number.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the database error occurred during setting the value.

      • tryRollback

        private void tryRollback(java.sql.Connection connection,
                         java.lang.Throwable t)
                  throws de.renew.unify.Impossible
        Tries to rollback the last database failed transaction.
        Parameters:
        connection - The database connection instance.
        t - The throwable which is the reason for rollback.
        Throws:
        de.renew.unify.Impossible - If the database error occurred during the transaction rollback.
